question: It is true that an operating system acts as a bridge between the user and the computer.
It is false that process management is responsible for managing the hardware devices connected to a computer.
It is true that the OS allocates CPU time and resources to multiple programs running simultaneously.
It is false that the OS does not manage memory allocation for running applications.
It is true that if there is not enough RAM, the OS uses virtual memory to prevent crashes.
It is false that file management is unrelated to the organization of stored data in a computer.
It is true that file management allows users to create, save, rename, and delete files.
It is false that device management only applies to software and has no connection with hardware devices.
It is true that the OS detects and installs necessary drivers when a new device is connected.
It is false that the OS does not provide any security features to protect user data.
It is true that the OS provides user authentication, such as passwords and PINs, for security.
It is false that antivirus software cannot work with the OS to remove malicious files.
It is true that file permissions allow users to restrict access to specific files.
It is false that all operating systems only use a graphical user interface (GUI).
It is true that some operating systems offer both GUI and Command Line Interface (CLI).
It is false that networking services in an OS are only used for connecting USB devices.
It is true that the OS manages internet connections and data transfer over networks.
It is false that an operating system does not detect and handle system errors.
It is true that the OS can detect hardware failures and display error messages.
It is false that an OS is not necessary for running modern computers.
It is true that an OS is responsible for managing both software and hardware.
It is false that the OS does not allow multiple applications to run at the same time.
It is true that multitasking allows multiple applications to run efficiently.
It is false that the OS does not use RAM for storing temporary data while programs run.
It is true that virtual memory helps when RAM is full by using a portion of the hard disk.
It is false that files stored on a computer do not need management by the OS.
It is true that an OS helps users organize files into folders and directories.
It is false that the OS has no role in managing printers or external devices.
It is true that device drivers help the OS communicate with external devices.
It is false that passwords and authentication methods are not part of OS security.
It is true that the OS provides firewalls and antivirus support to enhance security.
It is false that a computer can function efficiently without an operating system.
It is true that the OS provides networking services to connect computers to the internet.
It is false that the OS does not help detect or handle software errors.
It is true that if a program stops responding, the OS can terminate it.
It is false that the OS does not help users interact with the system through GUI or CLI.
It is true that Windows, Linux, and macOS provide GUI interfaces for users.
It is false that the OS does not manage file storage on external drives like USBs.
It is true that networking services allow data sharing between multiple computers.
It is false that the OS does not handle Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connections.
It is true that file permissions help control who can access or modify a file.
It is false that an OS does not allocate resources to different tasks.
It is true that process management ensures each program gets CPU time efficiently.
It is false that security features in an OS are unnecessary for modern computing.
It is true that OS security prevents unauthorized access and protects sensitive data.
